image.altText: A tin roof falling off the top of a building next to a fire truck.

props.synopsis: Five people are dead including a nine-year-old girl who got lost inside a storm drain in Brisbane's south as severe storms lashed Australia's east coast.Â

title.children: Girl lost in storm drain found dead, as storms and floods across Australia's east coast kill at least five people

image.altText: A man smiling.

props.synopsis: Bill Granger has died in hospital in London, his family has announced. The renowned chef and food writer ran 19 restaurants around the world.

title.children: Chef and food writer Bill Granger dies aged 54

image.altText: A group of workers in high vis pose smiling in front of machinery from a rocket

props.synopsis: The first locally made rocket to be launched into space from Australian soil is scheduled for lift-off from a commercial facility in Queensland early next year.

title.children: An Australian-made rocket will be launched in Queensland in a historic first

image.altText: Andoo Comanche sailing.

props.synopsis: Andoo Comanche holds a narrow lead over LawConnect at the start of the second day of the Sydney to Hobart yacht race, after race favourite SHK Scallywag retired on the opening day.

title.children: Sydney to Hobart race favourite retires as Andoo Comanche and LawConnect pull clear

image.altText: An illustration in blue and pink colours shows a woman sitting alone in a room looking out a window

props.synopsis: Long COVID is not just destroying people's health. Behind closed doors, in homes across Australia and abroad, it is irreversibly changing relationshipsÂ â sometimes for the better, too often for worse.

title.children: 'This is the end of the relationship': The marriages under strain from long COVID

image.altText: Coral bommies

props.synopsis: Once teeming with marine life, Cannindah Reef is now buried under Queensland cattle country. Could it help scientists protect the Great Barrier Reef as the climate changes?Â

title.children: How a long-buried, 300-million-year-old coral oasis could hold secrets to fighting climate change

image.altText: White man standing next to white electric car with orange dirt

props.synopsis: A former coal, oil and gas worker, Ray Middleton believes isolation shouldn't stop people from switching to electric vehicles.

title.children: Having worked in fossil fuels for three decades, Ray concedes he's not your typical EV enthusiast

image.altText: Emergency crews are stationed next to Penrith Beach.

props.synopsis: A missing swimmer's body has been found by emergency services at the newly-opened Penrith Beach in Sydney's west following reports he fell off a paddleboard and failed to resurface.

title.children: Emergency services discover missing swimmer's body at the newly opened Penrith Beach

image.altText: Smoke coming from behind trees in WA's outback

props.synopsis: WA Police are investigating the death of a volunteer firefighter responding to a blaze in the Shire of Esperance in the state's south.Â

title.children: 'Absolute tragedy': Volunteer firefighter dies while responding to Boxing Day blaze on WA's south coast

image.altText: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny is seen on a screen via video link from a penal colony.

props.synopsis: The jailed Russian opposition politician confirmed his arrival at the IK-3 penal colony north of the Arctic Circle, which is considered Russia's toughest prison.Â

title.children: Alexei Navalny says he is in 'good spirits' despite transfer to Arctic prison

image.altText: A woman holding a baby

props.synopsis: Despite a global surge in women freezing their eggs, nearly 9 out of 10 Victorians aren't returning to use their stored eggs. Advocates say more education could change what happens to them next.

title.children: More women are freezing their eggs. But what happens if they don't get used?

image.altText: A montage of black and white images of 2 women and 2 men with an artist blue graphic design on top.

props.synopsis: Australia technically avoided a recession in 2023, though living standards went backwards for most of the population. Here's what four leading economists tip could happen in 2024.

title.children: Australia narrowly avoided recession this year. Here's what these experts think will happen in 2024

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses smiles in front of the ocean with green hills in the distance

props.synopsis: Not everyone is satisfied with an office or working from homeÂ â they'd prefer to be operating from white-sand beaches and tropical rainforests. These Australians share the advantages and disadvantages of being a digital nomad.

title.children: These Australians work remotely while travelling overseas. But are they really living the dream?

image.altText: A woman in a bright outfit and hat

props.synopsis: When Meredith Campbell was diagnosed with acute depression with psychosis, she received electroconvulsive therapy. A clinical psychiatrist says there's still a widespread stigma around the treatment, despite it being deemed "safe and effective".

title.children: Six months ago, Meredith couldn't shower or drive. She says electroconvulsive therapy saved her life

image.altText: Side by side photos of Mary-Louise McLaws, Father Bob Maguire and Barry Humphries dressed as Dame Edna

props.synopsis: From master chefs and iconic artists to sporting legends and trailblazing politicians, Australia lost some of its most loved â and most controversial â icons this year.

title.children: Remembering the famous Australians who died this year

image.altText: A man in a shirt and jeans rides in bicycle along a bridge during the day in a Medieval-looking city.

props.synopsis: What can Australia learn from other cities reducing CBD traffic? It's about disincentives for drivers and incentives for those who choose other means of getting around.

title.children: This researcher analysed 12 ways cities are trying to cut traffic. A congestion tax worked best

image.altText: A Pakistan bowler shakes the hand of an Australian opponent during the men's Boxing Day Test.

props.synopsis: After inclement weather disrupted play on day one, Australia is looking to build a total in excess of 400 runs in its first innings against Pakistan at the MCG.

title.children: Aussies to 'put the accelerator down' in rain-affected Boxing Day Test

image.altText: A collage of colourful romance novels, most featuring cartoon illustrations of couples embracing.

props.synopsis: Readers are embracing romance novels with wild abandon and sending their favourite titles straight to number one. So we asked a bestselling romance author, publisher and bookseller why the genre is having such a moment.

title.children: Spice, escapism and a 'refreshing lack of shame': Why romance novels thrive on TikTok and dominate bestseller lists

image.altText: Sakib Kazi kneeling next to a drone.

props.synopsis: In the lead up to bushfire season, Zoos Victoria are embracing all forms of technological innovation to help ensure the survival of our most at-risk native fauna.

title.children: Drones and song meters: How Zoos Victoria is transforming conservation

image.altText: Coral bommies

props.synopsis: Once teeming with marine life, Cannindah Reef is now buried under Queensland cattle country. Could it help scientists protect the Great Barrier Reef as the climate changes?Â

title.children: How a long-buried, 300-million-year-old coral oasis could hold secrets to fighting climate change

image.altText: A woman in green shirt working at computer.

props.synopsis: Georgie Morse sees her ability to hyper focus on gardening tasks as a benefit of her attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder. But, ADHD has cost her in other ways â with calls for business to show understanding to people with the condition.

title.children: Georgie racked up $2,000 in parking fines, an experience she attributes to 'ADHD tax'

image.altText: Rusting cars with smashed windscreens among tropical palms.

props.synopsis: How does a pristine tropical island manage decades of rubbish? For one of Australia's most remote territories, it can be an expensive ordeal.

title.children: What does a pristine tropical island do with decades worth of dumped cars?

image.altText: A grey navy ship on the water with land in the background.

props.synopsis: Russia says two Ukrainian fighter jets were destroyed by anti-aircraft fire during the attack, however Ukraine has denied this claim.Â

title.children: Russia says naval ship in Crimea was damaged in air strike by Ukrainian forces

image.altText: An Israeli soldier rides in an armoured personnel carrier in Gaza.

props.synopsis: The Israeli defence minister says Lebanon, Syria, Iraq, and Yemen among possible locations in which actions have been taken.

title.children: Israel hints that it has struck international targets in retaliation

image.altText: Psychiatrist Dr Jerry Gelb avoided jail after taking a handgun into the Melbourne Magistrate's Court

props.synopsis: During the COVID-19 pandemic, Victoria's justice system experienced the biggest backlog of cases in the country, but things are returning to normal.

title.children: It's taken three years for Victoria's courts to clear a backlog and return to pre-pandemic levels

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne chases pigeons

props.synopsis: Pakistan dropped catches, David Warner offered them up and the crowd celebrated Shane Warne's fabulous legacy on Boxing Day at the MCG. Here are the five quick hits from day one.

title.children: Five quick hits â A shocking error, some unexpected beef and Shane Warne's legacy at the MCG

image.altText: Julian McLennan standing with his friends and holding his surfboard, which has shark bite marks.

props.synopsis: Julian McLennan was enjoying a Christmas Day surf near Taree when he felt something grab his leg, only to look across to see a "massive fin" come out of the water.

title.children: Teen's lucky escape after shark bite during Christmas Day surf

image.altText: A sign in a garden with trees and houses behind it reads Woorabinda.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a house fire in the Indigenous community ofÂ Woorabinda.

title.children: Man found dead in house fire in Central Queensland as police launch investigation

image.altText: People working in an old style General Store

props.synopsis: The general store at Cumnock in western New South Wales has had five owners over its 141-year history. Now it has a sixth: the town itself.

title.children: Small town buys 141-year-old general store to save it from closure

image.altText: group of women wearing colorful dresses and performing a traditional Indian dance

props.synopsis: In a spectacular display, tens of thousands of women wearing bright red and green colours in India's Gujarat state gather to perform the traditional 'Raas' dance to mark a two-day spiritual festival.Â

title.children: Preserving the tradition, thousands of Indian women dance in a festival of colour
